TopicTitle: Is there a good clouds mod?

Articles.Content:
Hello

My PC is not the most powerful, but it runs KSP ok. Apart form Mechjeb, I have no other mods, so I wondered if there was a good clouds mod. One which would not take up huge amounts of memory or processing power.

I have 4GB Ram and the processor is a dual 3.2 processor (Intel) Nvidia card.

Thanks

Keith
I recommend something like Sci-Fi or E.V.E. only. for a not too powerful PC.

I agree with genesis

its a good balance between high performance and good visuals

i actually use it even though i have a decent pc

Edited September 4, 2017 by ModerndayLink

Ok I will try the Sci-Fi one. I have downloaded it, how do I install it please?

Tried doing a search but it just talked about a star trek mod!

Keith

On ‎9‎/‎4‎/‎2017 at 12:02 PM, Silverwood said:

Ok I will try the Sci-Fi one. I have downloaded it, how do I install it please?

Tried doing a search but it just talked about a star trek mod!

Keith

When you open the zip file, you will find a folder titled SiFiVE-1.2 (or 1.3). open that file, inside you will find 2 files: "EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements" and "SciciVisualEnhancements". drag both of them into your Gamedata folder and start up the game.

Hi

Thanks - I did manage to get it to work! Unfortunately it slowed the game down, so I have removed it now.

Keith

4 hours ago, Silverwood said:

Hi

Thanks - I did manage to get it to work! Unfortunately it slowed the game down, so I have removed it now.

Keith

Try this cfg out. Just drop it in your gamedata with whatever visual pack you prefer. It removes all of the volumetric clouds, greatly improving the performance. 

https://www.dropbox.com/s/hilss93rvcjakib/EVE_2D.cfg?dl=0

Edited October 22, 2017 by Galileo
